title: The World
name: The World
description:
A Map by Soccerplaya120

Come and see some of the wonders of the world.

properties.name: Eiffel Tower
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris, France. It stands aproxamatly 300 meters tall. This makes it twice as high as the Washington Monument. This structure took a litte more than two years to finish. It also took about 12,000 peices of iron and 7 million nails to construct this structure. In 1889, the Eiffel Tower as built as a celebration of the French Revolution in 1789. The Eiffel Tower was built for the World Exhibitaion. The man who built the Eiffel Tower was named Gustave Eiffel. The Eiffel Tower was the tallest structure in the world from March 31, 1889 to 1930, when the Chrysler Building was built.

properties.name: Everglades National Park
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120 After the Seminole Wars, interest in the Everglades centered on its wildlife. These Seminole Wars took place from 1817 to 1858. The heron and egret birds are widely known for their feathers and the alligator for its hide. Since much of the wildlife has been reduced laws had to be passed in order to protect the wildlife in the everglades. This was in the early 20th century. Everglades National Park is the largest subtropical wilderness in the nation. The American Crocodile, Florida panther, and West Indian manatee are some of the most rare and endangered species in the Everglades. The Everglades also has 10 thousand islands.

properties.name: Golden Gate Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120he Golden Gate Bridge costed 5 million. It took 4 years to build. This bridge attracts thousands of visitors from around the world. The Golden Gate Bridge was opened on May 28, 1937 at twelve o\'clock noon. President Franklin D. Roosevelt pressed a telegraph key in the White House announcing this event. The Golden Gate Bridge\'s main suspension span is 4,200 feet long. This was a world record that stood for 27 years. The bridge\'s two towers rise 746 feet. Making them 191 feet taller than the Washington Monument. The five lane bridge crosses Golden Gate Strait which is about 400 feet, or 130 meters deep.

properties.name: Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120The Grand Canyon is a very colorful and beautiful sight. Some of the oldest human artifacts are found here. This dates back nearly up to 12,000 years old. It also dates back to the Paleo Indian period. Archaic, Basketmaker, Ancestral Puebloan (Kayenta and Virgin branches), Cohonina, Cerbat, Pai, Zuni, Hopi, Navajo, and Euro-American are some other culture groups that lived here at one point of time. The Grand Canyon National Park was established in 1919. The park has recorded over 4,800 archeological resources with an intensive survey of nearly 3% of the park area. It stretches across over 277 miles long and 18 miles wide. Today Grand Canyon National Park has close to five million visitors each year.

properties.name: Imperial Palace
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120The Imperial Palace is located in Tokyo, Japan. It was destroyed during World War II, but then rebuilt in the 1960s. This palace was the residence of the Imperial family of Japan.The original palace was not constructed on the grounds of the Shogun\'s palace. Today it is in the area of the East Garden. The buildings of the Imperial Palace were constructed by the Takenaka Corporation. Most of the palace is generally off-limits to the public. But the Imperial Household Agency does conduct tours. The East Gardens are usually accessible to tourists. The inner palace is open to the public. This takes place only two days during each year. These days are the Emperor\'s birthday and at the New Year. The Museum of Imperial Collections located on the grounds of the East Garden.

properties.name: Mt. Rushmore National Park
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120 Mount Rushmore National Park is located in Keystone, South Dakota. Mount Rushmore National Memorial is visited by about three million visitors a year from across the country and around the world. Mount Rushmore has grown in fame as a symbol of America.A symbol of freedom and a hope for people from all cultures and backgrounds. This memorial has the faces of the heads of former George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincon. The entire memorial covers 1,278 acres of land. It is also 5,725 feet above sea level. The carving started in 1927 and ended in 1941. Fortunately, there were only a few injuries and no deaths.

properties.name: St. Augustine
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120FloridaOn Sept. 8. 1565, Don Pedro Menendez de Aviles came ashore and named a stretch of land near the inlet in honor of Augustine. This man was a saint of the Roman Catholic Church. The University of Florida archaeologists found this location in recent years as being present-day Mission of Nombre de Dios and the Fountain of Youth stand. The Timucuan Indians were here first and watched Menendez and his party of around 1,500 soldiers and colonists. Since, the city has been under the governments of Spain, 1565 to 1763 and 1784-1821. Britain from 1763-1784, and United States, 1821-present. Florida became a state in 1845. It was part of the Confederacy from 1861-1862 when it returned to Union control.

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120Statue of Liberty, New YorkThe Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to show their friendship. This statue symbolizes freedom and democracy. The Statue of Liberty was dedicated on October 28, 1886. It was designated as a National Monument in 1924 and restored for her centennial on July 4, 1986. This monument was established after the Revolutionary War.Sculptor Frederic-Auguste Bartholdi was told to design a sculpture with the year 1876 in mind for completion. This was to remember the centennial of the American Declaration of Independence. The statue is 305 feet tall. The tablet in the statue\'s hand represents the birth of the United States on July 4, 1776.

properties.name: The Forbidden City
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120The Forbidden City is located in the middle of the ancient city of Beijing. There were 24 emperors that dwelled here during the Ming and Qing dynasties. The Forbidden City is currently a public museum and World Heritage site, attracting millions of travelers and tourists from all around the world. The Forbidden City covers about 720,000 square meters of Beijing. There are around 800 buildings. These buildings have a total of 9,000 rooms. This makes the Forbidden City the world’s largest palace complex in the world. This site was declared a World Heritage Site in 1987.

properties.name: The Great Pyramids
properties.description: Posted by Soccerplaya120The Great Pyramids are one of the seven wonders of the anchient world. The Great Pyramid of Giza is the largest of the three pyramids. These pyramids are located in Cairo,Egypt. They were built here in 2560 B.C. These pyramids have been in Egypt for over 3,800 years. These great structures took 20 years to construct. The Great Pyramid of Giza was built for a pharaoh named Khufu. It is estimated that it took 100,000 workers build this pyramid.
